content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No complete structure has been successfully placed on the map during these steps. Although recovery updates focused on supplying a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) and on operating furnaces for resource smelting, no Lab—or any connected production structure—was ultimately established.

ERROR TIPS
• API Argument Misuse for Entity Retrieval
  - When calling get_entities, avoid using unexpected keyword arguments (e.g. “radius”) or incorrect positional parameters. Verify the API signature and supply only the supported arguments. 

• Lab Placement Failures
  - Confirm that the Lab item is present in the inventory before attempting placement at (0.5, 2.5) to prevent placement errors.

• Iteration on a None Value
  - Ensure that functions retrieving entities return an iterable (such as an empty list) rather than None to avoid errors when filtering (e.g. for labs).

• Insufficient Resources for Lab Crafting
  - Multiple lab crafting attempts failed due to a shortage of necessary sub-ingredients (for example, lacking enough iron-gear-wheels, copper-cables, or electronic-circuits). Double-check that the complete resource chain—from raw materials to intermediary components—is adequately supplied before initiating lab crafting.

• Persistent Ingredient Deficits
  - Even after recovery updates (including additional smelting and copper cable production), missing ingredients (such as extra iron-gear-wheels) continued to block lab crafting. Review resource conversion steps and inventory management to ensure all required components are produced in sufficient quantities.
